result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob L. Ball was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample
No contact with AST or family
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 years
Mental health counseling
Sex offender treatment.  Sex offender registry
Full-time employment
No consumption of alcohol.  No bars/taverns
SORP compliance and payment toward his court ordered obligations and supervision fees
Comply with medications recommended by treatment providers

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
For each year that defendant on probation
Consecutive to: to 13CF110

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob L. Ball

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob L. Ball in court in custody, with attorney Thomas G Wilmouth.  Jill L Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 11:00 am  Cases called 13CF110, 14CF19, 14CF83 and 14CM73.   Court has received a presentence report.  No objections to facts in PSI.  Court has also reviewed letter from defense counsel.  14CF19 Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Def will enter a plea of No contest.  Ct 1 - Battery by prisoners - No contest plea.  Court reviews plea questionnaire.  Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  Factual basis for plea.  Court finds def understands charge, penalties and rights.  Plea accepted, found guilty.  Letter from DA dated 6-11-14 parties agree.  Plea agreement stated on record by Atty Laufenberg per letter.  One concern is in regards to a condition.  Parties agree.  PT reads victim statement.  Copy provided to the court.  No other victim statements.  State presents sentencing arguments.  Atty Wilmouth presents sentencing arguments.  Condition of no use of alcohol not be imposed by court.  Request that 50 hours of community service be imposed per yr while on probation.  Statement by def.  Sentencing statement by court.  13CF110 Ct 1 - 6 1/2 yr initial confinement  5 yrs extended supervision.  Conditions outlined on pg 16 of PSI - court reads into record.  Add no contact with AST  and family.  Community service 50 hours each yr on extended supervision  DNA sample and cost and DNA surcharge.  Firearms and voting rights reviewed.    Ct 2 3 1/2 prison  1 1/2 year initial  2  yrs extended supervision.  Conditions as outline except for community service.  Cost concurrent   Ct5 9 months jail.  concurrent.  Cost and DNA surcharge    Jail credit 353 days.  ct 5 completed with credit.  Ct 6 90 days jail, concurrent. with credit completed.  Court cost &  surcha.  14CF19 - 5 yrs prison 2 yrs initial  3 yrs extended Imposed and stayed 3 yrs probation.  Consecutive.  No credit.  Cost and DNA surcharge.  14CF83 - Ct 1 & 2 Dismissed and read in for the purpose of sentencing.  Victim rights have been complied with for all files.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  14CF19 Same conditions of probation as extended supervision.  Community service 50 hrs.  14CM73 dismissed.  Additional condition -  Comply with medications recommendations by treatment providers.   Written determinate  13CF110  def is not eligible  and 14CF19 def is not eligible

Defendant Jacob L. Ball in court with attorney Thomas G Wilmouth.  Defendant Jacob L. Ball in custody.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF19, 14CF83 and 14CM73 @ 9:03 a.m. 14CM73 - Copy of complaint received, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. 14CF83 - Copy of complaint received, reading waived, reserve juris. objections, time limits for prelim waived. State heard on bond. Court orders $5,000.00 signature bond for both files. Atty Wilmouth asks for cash bond, gives arguments. State will not object. Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond to cover both files. Court calls 14CF19 - Def is waiving preliminary hrg. Court reviews prelim rights, finds waiver freely made and finds probable cause. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived, not guilty plea. Court enters not guilty plea. 14CF83 - Atty Wilmouth moves to dismiss ct 1, gives argument. Response by State, asks Court to not dismiss at this time and allow filing of amended complaint. Court will allow State to file amended complaint. All files set for status conf./plea and sentencing 6/11/14 @ 11:00 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jacob L. Ball in court via video with attorney Thomas G Wilmouth.  Defendant Jacob L. Ball in custody.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Statement by defense counsel.  Status conf requested.  Bond recommendations.  Court sets bond  Case 13CF110 will follow  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
